intro: Chaetanthera affinis, commonly known as the slender moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its fragrant, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom at night. The plant has slender, ascending stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically short-lived, opening in the evening and closing by morning. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
